name: Lake Powell Resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Check-in was quick, efficient and friendly. Our first floor room was easily accessed from the parking lot. It was a nice, clean room with standard amenities, and it was only a short walk out to the pool.
reviews.title: Just an OK resort when Labor Day arrives

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Now, the first issue. The poolside bar advertised beer, but they close after the Labor Day weekend, so they didn't bother stocking beer for the last day of their season. Oddly, that rationale didn't extend to soft drinks or snacks. I guess toting a couple off cases of beer out would have been a logistical nightmare!
reviews.title: Beautiful Propery

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: As we experienced on past visits, the Rainbow Room, the resort's main dining option, was over-booked, with a wait of 1 3/4 hours at 6PM, and was expectedly pricey. We ate dinner at the Driftwood Lounge, next door, eating only breakfast at the Rainbow Room (Most bus tourists don't get up as early as us). Since the bus tourists are always around and always get most of the dining reservations, and the Rainbow is always crowded for lunch and dinner, isn't it time to open another dining option? The Wahweap Grille hardly counts as it is small, has a limited menu and fairly outrageous prices, and service is incredibly slow.
reviews.title: acceptable for 1 night

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: We had some last minute shopping to acccomplish before check-out, but both Lake Powell Sports and the camp store - the only places likely to have what we needed - closed early for the end of season.
reviews.title: Very nice location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Anyway, the gift shop was nice, and the facilities the resort provided for a pre-trip orientation were adequate.
reviews.title: Horrible!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Lake Powell has some great views and some good water sports facilities. That's it.
reviews.title: Ugly buildings, overpriced, poorly built and shabby.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you want good accommodation don't stay here. If you want reasonably priced not over elaborate food, don't eat here. The rooms are unbelievably spartan for the the high price and shabbily maintained. The lock of the patio had been forced at some time and didn't lock properly, the miniscule bathroom had a damaged doorframe, the headroom in the hall and the cloakroom is claustrophobic, the lakeside view on the bottom floor at the south end of block 6 is almost none existent, there's no wi-fi in the bedrooms this far from the reception lobby, spare electrical sockets don't exist in the bedroom, the TV is an ancient CRT model with very limited channels, there's no sofa or easy chairs, the aircon is noisy and the veranda furniture is two tatty chairs and no table. Certainly the worst $200+ dollar room we've ever encountered. The block itself looks like a correctional institution and if it was the inmates would riot over the standards.
reviews.title: Run Down

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Even the coffee shop's sandwiches were stale.
reviews.title: Disappointing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: There's absolutely nothing to recommend this resort hotel. To enjoy Lake Powell, book into somewhere in Page, eat and shop in Page (there's a good Safeway there). Just use Lake Powell for whatever water sports you fancy or scenic trips .... the Rainbow Bridge tour with great views was the only good feature of our stay.
reviews.title: Needs Renovation and Cleaning, not much choice in the area

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Hotel room was in very poor shape, stained carpets, old smells of mildew and smoke. This place is in need of a face lift. The gift shop had a good selection of items and the restaurant is not anything special.
reviews.title: Great location
Great location
reviews.text: The hotel and marina is about 6 miles outside Page in the National Park. If one is lucky enough to get a lake view room in block 7 or 8 then the view over the lake is stunning. The only wifi is in the lobby so that can be a long walk from the bedroom which is irritating. Service in the restaurants can be very slow. There seems to be policy to make diners wait at least 5 minutes even if the restaurant is nearly empty! We dined most evenings in Page.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The boat tours from the hotel tend to be very crowded - coach loads come to the hotel to join the tours. We went instead to Antelope Canyon Boat Tours which was brilliant. It is close to the spectacular Antelope Canyon and the four of us had a boat to ourselves. Captain Dave was
reviews.title: Resort View Perfect

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: great.
reviews.title: Very good, serves the purpose

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The views at Lake Powell Resort are amazing. Every room that faces the water has a view that one could look at forever and never tire of. There were several things that could be improved upon. The resort is located in a National Park that required a pass to be purchased ($15) prior to entering. I feel that the resort could have e-mailed a complimentary pass when the reservation is confirmed. The rooms run about $140/night. The rooms are clean, for the most part, but hair was found on the bathtub and there was grime on the floor in back of the toilet. No microwave in the room. The restaurant was poor. Food choices were very limited and no healthy food choices. The cafe had really poor quality sandwiches that we bought the next day for a light lunch. They were a day old and soggy. We went to Dennys just outside the marina for two meals and once we went into Page for breakfast. No elevators in the resort, so pick a first floor room if you have any problems climbing stairs with luggage. The landscape looks fine from a distance, but a closer look shows the lack of upkeep (weeds, weeds, weeds) bushes and shrubs have lots of dead growth that needs to be cut back. The staff was WONDERFUL!! Could not have asked for better service. Everyone was friendly and helpful. I guess that people don't go there for the resort, they go for the day trips on Lake Powell and the views. I just thought that the resort was not up to what I expected.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, convenient to Lake Powell activities

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you travel to this area your choices are very limited as to where to stay. I don't recommend staying in Page ( which is 8 miles away from the Lake Powell) becuase the village itself is unattractive. Besides 15 churches, few motels, a school, a Marriott on its offset, and a huge Wal-Mart accross the road there is nothing. I recommend staying at Lake Powell resort, at least you have excellent views of the lake, boat tours are arrange daily, restaurants are on site, 2 pools. The rooms are well maintained but small. I feel that a room with 2 queen beds that is designed for at least 4 people is suitable only for 3 ( 2 adults and one child). There is very limited walking space. I guess the assumption is that you are always outside. The other minus is a noisy AC/Heat unit in the room. Otherwise, the hotel met our needs to accomodate us for 2 nights to explore the area: the lake Powell, Canon Glen Dam, Anthelope Canyons, and Colorado River. A tip for the Anthelope canyons: we visited during a srping break ( april 2012) and instead of booking with the private companies in Page, we asked for the directions at the hotel desk, drove directly to the canyons and took a guided trip directly from there. It is cheapper that way and no commitments. The tours are going often as soon as a group of about 12 people fills in. The cost at the time was: $6 per adult per parking ( children 5 and under are free), plus $25 an adult ( child 5 and uder free) for a guided tour.
reviews.title: Ok

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: My family and I spent 2 nights at the resort during the spring break. We arrived late and the check in was very quick. We were given a choice of first floor or second floor and I chose the second floor. We were assigned a room on the same building as the lobby and the restaurant which is nice since it was a short walk for breakfast and dinner.
reviews.title: Average Resort with great view on Lake Powell

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: Keep in mind that the room we were assigned (2nd floor) did not have elevator. So, we have to carry our luggage up the stairs by ourselves. If you have this difficulty, I would strongly suggest to get the room on the first floor. The ceiling on the walkway to room is only 7 feet tall. I am 5'10'' and I could reach the ceiling tiles. So, just be warned for those who are above 6".
reviews.title: Could have been better
Do not miss lake Powell resort
reviews.text: Back to the room. The resort itself is a little dated but the room is clean. The room has TV and a small refrigerator. We were expecting also a microwave oven since we are staying in a resort but it disappointed us as we have a 2-year boy and we need to heat up the milk in the morning and bed time. The bathroom is good size and the beds are comfortable. We did not get the view as we booked a standard room. A room with the lake view would cost $20 more a night. The AC is a little old (single unit) but working. We did not use it a lot since it was at mid 70s when we were there. I noticed first floor rooms have a newer (split unit) AC installed. May be this is type is quieter?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The resort has 2 pools. One close to the lobby (non-heated) and a bigger one (heated) a block away to the west. Our 9-year son enjoyed swimming in the bigger one as the water was warmer.
reviews.title: Satisfied with our experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had dinner at the restaurant on the second night and the food was good. The pricing is slightly higher compare to the restaurants at Page and it is a little fancy. I would recommend to make a reservation in advance. We only went to "cafeteria" to get coffee in the morning. The place also offers sandwiches, espresso, bagels, muffins for breakfast. Not sure about noon time as we were out sightseeing.
reviews.title: Really Disappointed!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed at this hotel for two nights while touring the national parks.
reviews.title: Great for doing Boat Trips on the Lake

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled solo
reviews.text: The rooms are quite spread out around the resort so you could have a fair walk to the restaurant - we were ok though, quite close. Our room was fairly nicely furnished and decorated, with patio doors onto a small terrace overlooking the car park, so not very private, but pleasant. Half of the rooms have terraces and balconies overlooking the water, which would be much better. The air conditioning in the rooms was very noisy.
reviews.title: Convenient location for Lake Powell boatrips

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We ate in the restaurant on the first night and the food was really rather good. However, on the second night, the menu had not changed so rather limited choice. They only serve food in the restaurant or bar (same food) although I understand another restaurant will be opening shortly which hopefully will improve the choices for guests. We decided to eat in the bar and after waiting for over 40 minutes for the food the soup was stone cold. When we told the waitress she said "You're kidding me right"? She took it away and after another wait of about 20 minutes, brought me more - only slightly warmer, with no apology or anything - bit disappointing.
reviews.title: Almost Good

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: They had a nice selection of wines though and we did enjoy sitting at the bar area and then at the open air fire pit over-looking the lake.
reviews.title: Family Trip

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: Breakfast is buffet style and you will always find something to eat - not too bad.
reviews.title: Hard to find, but worth it

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is not a 5 star resort. That fact should be assumed in advance since it is run by huge food services provider Aramark. It is, however, a nice, clean place with decent food, good service and convenient location. The rooms are nicely appointed. The beds are comfortable and the bathroom clean. The room does seem dated however (maybe it was the 1994 model Sony Trinitron TV). Lighting in the shower room are very dim and the built-in air conditioning unit was a little temperamental but functioned fine after a little fiddling. Property wide wi-fi worked fine but Verizon coverage was spotty at best (not the fault of the hotel, of course). The bar was lively and the limited menu provided enough options for us to eat lunch twice, the main dining room served a decent breakfast buffet and pretty good dinner. Lake tour was very nice and the process for renting a boat for a day on the lake was handled efficiently.
reviews.title: Safe choice on Lake Powell

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: We stayed in a full hookup site in the RV camp. The RV camp is very spacious, comfortable and beautiful.
reviews.title: Very comfortable RV camping near amazing lake Powel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: The site istelf included a fire location, BBQ location and a faily big table.
reviews.title: Fabulous location, but overcrowded!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: There was a with a very nice view on lake Powel.
reviews.title: OHH MAN THIS IS GREAT

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: The amazing beach is within a walking distance.
reviews.title: Not sure if there are any better options

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent 2 nights here and were happy with the accomodation which was well located for the Lake. Enjoyed the pool ( and our view of a roadrunner that walked past). Enjoyed the boat tri and the visit to the Dam.
reviews.title: Pleasant stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: My family of five stayed here for 2 nights after a visit from Grand Canyon. The room is a little spacious. It has only fridge but no microwave. Be prepared for rowdy neighbors. There's a total darkness in parking lot at night. You need a flashlight to walk in the lot (in case there's a King Cobra?). The large pool has no hand rails or safety railings for kids to hold on. There's a gap of about 2+ feet from the pool water to the top of the pool. There's too much chlorine in the pool. There're also paper floating beneath the pool. The scene is breath taking. The Marinas are out of control. The lake's water levels are dropping in half but yet the marinas are at least doubled in size in last 10 years. Do not swim at the resort beach. It's muddy and abandoned. Enthusiastic photographers must see lower Antelope Canyon. There's a place for kids and family to swim and cool off after the visit that about 10-min away on a marina.
reviews.title: Dangerous and filthy pool

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: The resort has a great view !! It seems to be a one night stand for lots of bus tours. The food is expensive & so-so selection. Doesn't really have a coffee shop. Must go to the bar if one wants a small meal at night. Had a cat & paid extra for him to stay. We had trouble with getting the room cleaned, on two separate days, etc. (took cat out of room for 2+ hrs each time to be cleaned) We stayed 4 nights & one day really got no cleaning, left no towels & TP. Had trouble with the Supervisor of the Maids. Management called us about our stay several weeks later. Asked what they could do. I requested one night free. The hotel person stated, she had to talk with her Supervisor. Have received no further communications and/or gift certificate. POOR, PR !!!!
reviews.title: Great View

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrived from Cedar city using the north entrance and found the hotel easily. Check in was fast and some how are friends were booked in a different building. They quickly made a change and we had rooms next to each other. Our stay was for 2 days and we loved the place. Had a boat tour of antelope canyon and dinner in the rainbow room. Both were excellent. We asked for a lake view and loved it. Rooms are expensive but nice with flat screen TV's and WiFi. We parked the bikes here and enjoyed but there are a few places to ride.
reviews.title: Motorcycle trip

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: When booking this hotel, I read a lot of feedback on Tripadvisor. Comments were really mixed, good and bad. I long time hesitated before to confirm my booking. We had a double suite rooms. We were in there renovated building. So for us rooms wise it was perfectly fine. Bathroom was not renovated, but still ok. You should ask for a room facing the lake. The different comments regarding the pool are true. It is small and not very clean. But the lake is just 2 steps away, so you rather swim in the lake. We found that the restaurant and breakfast were good. You mainly pay the view rather. The sunset view is great.
reviews.title: You pay for the view, but it worth it

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: This resort is in the national park. There is a charge to enter the park that is not mentioned by the hotel. This was simply a hotel room. Everything I expected was there with very comfortable beds and a clean room. Good ac and pleasant staff. The view is what you are paying for and accessible to water tours and events. We loved it.
reviews.title: Gorgeous

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: Now the down side. Only one small sink in the bathroom without privacy from the toilet. The restaurant here is gorgeous with fabulous views. However, you are paying top of the line prices for what was absolutely mediocre food. It's a common thread here so buyer beware. We knew, we paid it and made the best of it. Breakfast buffet 15pp and also mediocre. Improve or simply
reviews.title: Great view, poor food service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Lower your price.
reviews.title: Superb views

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: I hope the resort takes these reviews into account and revitalizes the restaurant. It has tons of potential and could have an old fashioned ball room theme. We ate at the restaurant at El Tovar in the Grand Canyon. Same prices , but the food was amazing. They need to figure this out. Also, they need to figure out their wifi situation. Guests no longer wish to endure this type of inconvenience. Wifi should be powerful and in every room without charge.
reviews.title: a poor experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This resort has all the potential in the world to be great. I truly hope they figure it out.
reviews.title: After Lots of Desert it was a nice change

description: A combination marina, hotel, campgrounds, and restaurant in the Lake Powell area.
